Even alcohol intake in moderate predisposes a person to B12 and folate deficiency.

Low plasma levels of active B6 are found in chronic alcohol dependence, obese states, and protein-energy malnutrition. Pregnancy, preeclampsia and eclampsia, and malabsorptive states such as celiac, inflammatory bowel disease, and bariatric surgery.

B1(thiamin) deficiency can result in poor intake, decreased absorption, increased loss (diarrhea, diuretics, dialysis) or increased consumption (pregnancy, lactation and hyperthyroidism).
